newsitem.title: UK: Wagon in talks to sell retail division.
newsitem.headline: Wagon in talks to sell retail division.

text.p: Wagon Industrial Holdings Plc said on Tuesday it was in talks with a number of parties for the sale of its retail division.
News of the possible sale follows Wagon's announcement in March that its range of activities needed to be more tightly focused on its engineering businesses with good growth prospects.
"In line with this strategy it has been resolved that the retail division does not form a natural part of the long term future of the group," said the firm in a statement today.

The company, which makes precision springs, wire forms, tubes and pressings, has already revealed that it will take an exceptional charge of 35 million stg, excluding goodwill, for the overall group restructuring.

Wagon expects pre-tax profits of not less than 20 million stg for the year to March 31, 1997 and plans to recommend a final dividend of 5p per share to make a total of 12p for the year. Results are due in early July.
It made pre-tax profit of 19.9 million stg in the year to March 31, 1996 and paid a total dividend of 19.75p per share.
